msgSnippet: This seems to be the same old issue with ClassLoaders. Try this. In the directory indicated by the user.home property, create a file called junit.properties

Subject: Re: [junit] Re: Native Library already loaded in another classloader

--------------1B72D502EB76305840048DA6
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

This seems to be the same old issue with ClassLoaders. Try this.

In the directory indicated by the user.home property, create a file called
junit.properties which has the following

loading=false

This should solve your problem.

Rama

jim.hollingsworth@... wrote:

> I too have seen this.  It only seems to happen (at least for me) when
> I use the GUI,  if I run with junit.textui.TestRunner I do not see
> it.  Seems as if the GUI loads it once and trys to re-use it over and
> over.
>
> Jim
>
> --- In junit@y..., Scott Coleman <scott.coleman@1...> wrote:
> >
> > I was under the impression that a native class should only be
> loaded once and that is why most
> > loadLibrary calls are done in a wrapper class that loads the
> library in its static initializer so
> > that it is only loaded once.
> >
> >  On Fri,
> > 26 Jan 2001, you wrote: Hi,
> >
> > The code I'm testing calls System.loadLibrary( "JNIExperiment" )
> > once. One test run gets green. But every second(!) time I hit the
> > TestRunner Run button I get the following exception:
> >
> > java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: Native Library JNIExperiment.dll
> > already loaded in another classloader.
> >
> > What to do?
> >
> > Regards
> >
> > Marc
> >
> >
> >

thanks,
Rama

<tt>This seems to be the same old issue with ClassLoaders. Try this.</tt><tt></tt>
<p><tt>In the directory indicated by the user.home property, create a file
called junit.properties which has the following</tt><tt></tt>
<p><tt>loading=false</tt><tt></tt>
<p><tt>This should solve your problem.</tt><tt></tt>
<p><tt>Rama</tt><tt></tt>
<p>jim.hollingsworth@... wrote:
<blockquote TYPE=CITE>I too have seen this.  It only seems to happen

<br>I use the GUI,  if I run with junit.textui.TestRunner I do not
see
<br>it.  Seems as if the GUI loads it once and trys to re-use it over
and
<br>over.
<p>Jim
<p>--- In junit@y..., Scott Coleman <scott.coleman@1...> wrote:
<br>>
<br>> I was under the impression that a native class should only be
<br>loaded once and that is why most
<br>> loadLibrary calls are done in a wrapper class that loads the
<br>library in its static initializer so
<br>> that it is only loaded once.
<br>>
<br>>  On Fri,
<br>> 26 Jan 2001, you wrote: Hi,
<br>>
<br>> The code I'm testing calls System.loadLibrary( "JNIExperiment" )
<br>> once. One test run gets green. But every second(!) time I hit the
<br>> TestRunner Run button I get the following exception:
<br>>
<br>> java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: Native Library JNIExperiment.dll
<br>> already loaded in another classloader.
<br>>
<br>> What to do?
<br>>
<br>> Regards
<br>>
<br>> Marc
